item.title: Brave New World
item.description: ‘Oh wonder! How many goodly creatures are there here! How beauteous mankind is! Oh brave new world, That has such people in’t.’ — William Shakespeare, The Tempest Truth be told, I’ve never actually read The Tempest, however this iconic excerpt is the inspiration for the title of one of my favorite books of all time: Aldous Huxley’s Brave New World. The book is set in a futuristic, technological dystopia where humans are manufactured using artifical wombs and biologically engineered into different castes that each play pre-determined roles in society.
